scheduler.generate
Class ScheduleItem

java.lang.Object
  scheduler.generate.ScheduleItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ScheduleItem>
public class ScheduleItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ScheduleItem>

Represents a single, scheduled item in the overall schedule. Contains information regarding:

  • The instructor teaching
  • The course he/she will teach
  • Where the course will be taught
  • When (time and day(s)) it'll be taught
  • If applicable, an additional SI for the "lab" component
Each ScheduleItem has a "value", which represents how valuable it is to the instructor it represents. A higher value means equates to a higher desirability. A desire of 0 is considered impossible. In fact, there's a special constant used to represent an "impossible" SI.

Author:
Eric Liebowitz
See Also:

Constant Field Values

i

public Instructor i

c

public Course c
The course for this scheduled item

l

public Location l
The location for this scheduled item

section

public int section
Course section (will someday be removed)

days

public Week days
The days in the week this item is scheduled

start

public Time start
The time at which this scheduled item starts. Do not access this field directly. Use getters/setters, as this is no longer used for SI computations.

end

public Time end
The time at which this scheduled item ends. Do not access this field directly. Use getters/setters, as this is no longer used for SI computations.

tr

private TimeRange tr
Time range representing when this ScheduleItem starts/ends. This is what is used in place of "start" and "end". However, when I added this new field, loads of other classes already depended on the public "start" and "end" fields. So, I've left them there. But be kind: use this instead for all your time range needs. Or, be even more kind and use the setters/getters. (In fact, you have to be, as it's private).

locked

public boolean locked
Whether this SI is locked into the schedule or not

lab

public ScheduleItem lab
The lab that goes with the class this SI represents, if any

value

public int value
How "valuable" this course/time combination is to the Instructor.

public boolean overlaps(ScheduleItem si)
Used to determine whether this SI overlaps with another one.

Returns:

compareTo

public int compareTo(ScheduleItem si)
Compares this to another ScheduleItem according to the double returned by their "getValue" method. The return of this method is simply the return of "Double.compare(double, double)".

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ScheduleItem>
Parameters:
si - The other ScheduleItem whose value is to be compare with this one's.
Returns:
Double.compare(this.getValue(), si.getValue())

getValue

public double getValue()
Returns how "valuable" this ScheduleItem is, where "value" is determined by how closely the fields of this object adhere to the most desirable preferences of the instructor it represents. This method will take the following fields into account, so long as each of them is valid (i.e. not null. If they are null, they just won't be considered):
  • Start and end time
  • Days to be taught
  • Course to teach
The fields applied to the "lab" field are also considered, but only if the lab is actually defined.

Returns:
the sum of all the instructors preferences for this object's fields. Thus, a higher number means a higher value.

equals

public boolean equals(ScheduleItem s)
Compares to ScheduleItem's.

Parameters:
s - The object to compare with "this"
Returns:
true if all the fields in "s" are equal to those in "this". False otherwise. Note that the "locked" value is not incorporated in this check.

dumpAsPerlText

public void dumpAsPerlText(java.io.PrintStream ps)
Dumps the data of this object to text as easy-to-parse Perl code. In particular, the following pieces of data are dumped into a hash ref to be eval'd by Perl:
  • id => this.c_this.sectio_this.c.getCourseType()
  • course => this.c
  • instructor => this.i.getId()
  • location => this.l
  • days => this.days
  • start => this.start
  • end => this.end
  • value => this.value

Parameters:
ps - PrintStream to dump text to
